entry.title: Almost half Vanuatu people lack clean water, month after cyclone: UNICEF
UN appeals for $20 million for Vanuatu cyclone victims
entry.summary: The cyclone's winds of 270 kilometers (168 miles) per hour devastated much of the archipelago on March 13, killing 17 people and leaving about 65,000 homeless.

entry.title: UN appeals for $20 million for Vanuatu cyclone victims
entry.summary:
UNITED NATIONS (AP) - The United Nations is appealing for nearly $20 million for victims of Cyclone Pam which tore through the South Pacific island nation of Vanuatu last month.

A U.N. appeal for about $30 million was launched on March 24 to cover the needs of 166,000 cyclone-affected people for three months but Dujarric said that to date donors have given only $10.7 million, just 36 per cent.

entry.title: Coney Island Cyclone Roller Coaster Gets Stuck On Opening Day
Coney Island roller coaster mishap briefly strands riders
entry.summary: Witnesses tell the Daily News (http://nydn.us/1IbCmov ) about 24 passengers on the first run of the Cyclone at Luna Park on Sunday were readying for the initial drop when it suddenly stopped.

entry.title: Ex-cyclone to cause wild weather in NT
entry.summary: "It's just a community that's never had a cyclone shelter and never had a coded building which can accommodate the 400-odd resident population," he told the ABC.

entry.title: Ex-cyclone to cause wild weather in NT
entry.summary: Ex-tropical Cyclone Nathan is forecast to cause wild weather across some parts of Northern Territory as it continues to move west across the Top End.

entry.title: Cyclone crosses remote Australian coast near evacuated island
entry.summary: SYDNEY (Reuters) - Tropical Cyclone Nathan smashed into northern Australia on Tuesday bringing gale-force winds and heavy rainfall to one of the country's most remote regions.

entry.title: 5 things to know about Vanuatu's devastating cyclone
entry.summary: This aerial view of a small island in Vanuatu's north shows the extent to which the island has been denuded by Cyclone Pam, on Friday, March 20, 2015.

entry.title: 5 things to know about Vanuatu's devastating cyclone
entry.summary: A radio station is destroyed by Cyclone Pam, Thursday, March 19, 2015, on Tanna Island, Vanuatu.

entry.title: 5 things to know about Vanuatu's devastating cyclone
entry.summary:
People living on hard-hit Tanna and many of the other islands may have survived the cyclone, but they have no way of knowing how their relatives or friends are faring elsewhere.

The cyclone has knocked down fruit-bearing trees and destroyed crops across the country.

Aid agencies, many of which were active in Vanuatu before the cyclone, have arrived in sometimes overwhelming numbers.

Cyclone Pam transformed much of Vanuatu from a tropical green to a dirty brown overnight, as coconut trees were stripped of their foliage and snapped like matchsticks and even some mighty banyan trees were toppled.

entry.title: A week after Vanuatu cyclone, some homeless still await help
Thousands wait for relief in Vanuatu as death toll hits 13
entry.summary: The cyclone wiped out gardens, killed livestock and contaminated the water supply in many areas, and agricultural experts estimate that those displaced by the storm will run out of food in less than a week.

entry.title: Cyclone Nathan makes landfall in Australia, losses strength
entry.summary:
SYDNEY - A powerful tropical cyclone was losing strength after crossing Australia's north-east coast on Friday, with no immediate reports of injuries.

Cyclone Nathan made landfall shortly before dawn as a category four system, the second highest intensity rating, and was expected to continue its westward movement inland while weakening, according to Australia's Bureau of Meteorology.

The cyclone is expected to lose much of its punch over land, but meteorologists warned it could reform again if it reaches the warm waters of the Gulf of Carpentaria, 250 km (155 miles) from the coast.

entry.title: Vanuatu provides lessons in cyclone survival [Photos]
Cyclone survivors desperate for aid
entry.summary: With power, phones and Internet still down across much of the country, officials faced logistical headaches in sorting out where to send supplies, particularly in Tanna Island, which was hit hard by Cyclone Pam's 168mph winds.

entry.title: Great Barrier Reef braces for cyclone hit
entry.summary: A month ago, Cyclone Marcia slammed into the southern part of the same coast, causing billions of dollars in damage and leaving thousands homeless or without electricity.

entry.title: Great Barrier Reef region braces for Cyclone Nathan
entry.summary: Northeastern Australia has battened down the hatches as it prepares for a strong cyclone forecast to hit coastal areas north of Cairns.

entry.title: Fears of food, water shortages persist as relief groups rush aid to Vanuatu
entry.summary: Baldwin Lonsdale, Vanuatu's president, returned to his country on Tuesday night from Japan, where had been attending a UN disaster conference when the cyclone struck.

entry.title: Food concerns mount in Vanuatu after cyclone Pam
Relief teams reach Vanuatu's cyclone-hit outer islands
entry.summary: Adrian Banga surveys his destroyed house in Port Vila, Vanuatu in the aftermath of Cyclone Pam, Monday, March 16, 2015.

entry.title: Relief teams reach Vanuatu's cyclone-hit outer islands
entry.summary: In this March 15, 2015 photo provided by UNICEF Pacific, residents work to recover from Cyclone Pam in Mele village, on the outskirts of the capital Port Vila, Vanuatu.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam lifts chance of El Nino this year in Australia, forecasters says
entry.summary:
The chances of an El Nino event, unusual warmth in large parts of the Pacific, have "had a real kick along" from Cyclone Pam.

Cyclone Pam's impact may not be restricted to devastating the island nation of Vanuatu - it may also have boosted the likelihood of an El Nino event for later this year, the Bureau of Meteorology said.

The chances of an El Nino have "had a real kick along" from Cyclone Pam, said Andrew Watkins, manager of climate prediction services at the bureau.

entry.title: Rescue teams reach cyclone stricken Vanuatu [Photos]
entry.summary: Relief workers were still battling to reach many of the islands pummel by Cyclone Pam's gusts of more than 300 kph (185 mph) on Friday and Saturday.

entry.title: Rescue teams reach cyclone stricken Vanuatu islands, official toll lowered
Cyclone Pam: Is it time for a category-6 cyclone rating?
entry.summary:
Jonathan Nott, a professor at James Cook University and expert on cyclone history, said there has "been a lot of discussion over the last five to 10 years" about the need to extend the cyclone severity rating beyond the current maximum of five.

According to the New Zealand's MetService, satellites indicate Cyclone Pam reached mean wind speeds of 270 km/h, with gusts even higher as it passed over the Pacific island nation.

Based on the differences between category-3 and -4 cyclones, a category-6 cyclone would signal mean wind speeds of about 240 km/h or stronger, with a central pressure of less than 915 hPa.

In the case of Cyclone Pam, Professor Nott said the worst of the storm missed Port Vila, with islands to the south, such as Erromango, likely to have received a direct hit.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam: Is it time for a category-6 cyclone rating?
entry.summary: The unusual strength of Cyclone Pam, which devastated Vanuatu over the weekend, may stir debate about the need for a category-6 rating for storms to reflect their increasing severity.

entry.title: AP Interview: Vanuatu President Rues Cyclone Devastation
entry.summary: Baldwin Lonsdale, president of Vanuatu, the Pacific island nation devastated by a powerful tropical storm last week, was attending a disaster conference in the Japanese city of Sendai when the cyclone struck.

entry.title: Cyclone-ravaged Vanuatu struggles to determine scale of damage, deaths as aid starts flowing
entry.summary: Radio and telephone communications with the outer islands were just beginning to be restored, but remained patchy four days after Cyclone Pam tore through the islands.

entry.title: Vanuatu Struggles to Account for Cyclone Damage
entry.summary:
Looking weary and red-eyed, Baldwin Lonsdale said in an interview Monday with The Associated Press that the latest information he has is that six people are confirmed dead and 30 injured from Cyclone Pam.

Officials in Vanuatu had still not made contact with outlying islands and were struggling to determine the scale of devastation from the cyclone, which tore through early Saturday, packing winds of 270 kilometers (168 miles) per hour.

entry.title: Vanuatu president, heading home from Japan disaster conference, rues devastation from cyclone
entry.summary:
A: "Cyclone Pam has devastated Port Vila. More than 90 percent of the buildings and houses in Port Vila have been destroyed or damaged. The state of emergency that has been issued is only for Port Vila. Once we receive an update on the extent of the damage in the provinces then another state of emergency will be issued for the outer islands."

A: "This is a very devastating cyclone in Vanuatu. I term it as a monster, a monster. It's a setback for the government and for the people of Vanuatu. After all the development that has taken place, all this development has been wiped out. So it means we will have to start anew again."

entry.title: Cyclone Pam: Australia gives Vanuatu $5 million in aid
entry.summary: Cyclone Pam left a trail of devastation across the Pacific island nation on Saturday, with 250 km/h winds levelling entire villages in the capital, Port Vila.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam: 'It was like a velociraptor', as Australians survive Vanuatu cyclone
entry.summary:
A woman carrying a baby stands with children outside homes damaged by Cyclone Pam in Port Vila.

While the worst of the storm lasted for just twelve hours, the cyclone has left a lasting mark on the people and infrastructure of Vanuatu, Mr Ang told Fairfax Media while he queued for petrol on the Kumul Highway.

"Because there's only one ring road around the island of Efate, that was - and is - the only way to get you out of the north of the Island into town, into Port Vila. During the cyclone, that was ripped up and washed away. So we had to swim across that this afternoon to get to my friend's car," Ang said.

entry.title: Aid workers say 8 people confirmed dead in Vanuatu cyclone
entry.summary: Packing winds of 270 kilometers (168 miles) per hour, Cyclone Pam tore through Vanuatu early Saturday, leaving a trail of destruction and unconfirmed reports of dozens of deaths.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam death toll to 'increase significantly' in Vanuatu
entry.summary:
A Nasa satellite image of cyclone Pam as the eye of the storm passes just east of Vanuatu.

"It's an absolutely devastating sight. We're seeing whole buildings and structures blown away. And those were large buildings - the smaller structures people are living in just didn't have a chance in category five cyclone.

They would have been picked up "like confetti" by the winds, Ms Morrison said, as the cyclone ravaged the islands from Friday night to Saturday morning.

entry.title: Vanuatu appeals for aid after cyclone 'calamity'
entry.summary: Fiji Weather Service meteorologist Neville Koop said the cyclone was weakening as it slowly moved away from Vanuatu, and would pass between Fiji and New Caledonia before brushing the North Island of New Zealand on Monday.

entry.title: Dozens feared dead in Vanuatu after cyclone Pam leaves trail of destruction
entry.summary: "Homes have been blown to pieces, and even evacuation shelters, where people had sought refuge, have been flooded and left exposed to the cyclone," said Charlie Damon of Care International.

entry.title: Aid workers say 8 people confirmed dead after cyclone hits Vanuatu in South Pacific
Residents in Vanuatu hunker in shelters for a second night after massive cyclone hits Pacific islands
entry.summary: WELLINGTON, New Zealand - Residents in cyclone-ravaged Vanuatu hunkered in emergency shelters for a second straight night Saturday after venturing out to find their homes damaged or blown away by the powerful storm, aid workers said.

entry.title: Dozens feared dead as cyclone pounds Pacific island of Vanuatu
entry.summary: UNICEF spokeswoman Alice Clements described the cyclone as "15-30 minutes of absolute terror" for "everybody in this country" as it passed over.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam: Dozens feared dead in Vanuatu
entry.summary: RAW VISION: Dozens are feared dead as Cyclone Pam brings devastating winds, torrential rain and huge waves destroyed much of Efate and surrounding islands.

entry.title: UN head urges better help, safeguards for climate-related disasters as cyclone slams Vanuatu
entry.summary: "I am speaking to you today with a heart that is so heavy. I do not really know what impact the cyclone has had on Vanuatu," Vanuatu's president, Baldwin Lonsdale, told the U.N. World Conference on Disaster Risk Reduction in the northeastern Japanese city of Sendai.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam leaves trail of destruction in Pacific's Vanuatu
entry.summary:
In this photo provided by non-governmental organization 350.org, debris is scattered over a building in Port Vila, Vanuatu, Saturday, March 14, 2015, in the aftermath of Cyclone Pam.

Communication systems in many of the hard-hit outer islands remained down, meaning it could take some time before the full extent of the damage caused by Cyclone Pam is known.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam leaves swath of destruction in Pacific's Vanuatu
entry.summary:
WELLINGTON, New Zealand -- Winds from an extremely powerful cyclone that blew through the Pacific's Vanuatu archipelago were beginning to subside Saturday, revealing widespread destruction and unconfirmed reports of dozens of deaths.

The U.N. Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs said there were unconfirmed reports of deaths in Vanuatu's northeastern islands after Cyclone Pam moved off its expected track.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam Leaves Trail of Destruction in Pacific's Vanuatu
entry.summary: A westward change of course put populated areas directly in the path of Cyclone Pam's 270 kilometer (168 mile) -per-hour winds.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam hits small Pacific nation of Vanuatu
Small Pacific Nation of Vanuatu hit by powerful cyclone PAM
entry.summary: The cyclone has already destroyed some homes and caused damage to other Pacific islands including Kiribati and the Solomon Islands.

entry.title: Flooding, destructive winds as Cyclone Pam bears down on Vanuatu
entry.summary: He said they could be more destructive than Cyclone Uma, which killed at least 30 people when it sank two ferries off Port Vila.

entry.title: Cyclone Marcia: Climate change is expanding the tropics
entry.summary:
Gold Coast residents are "scared of the cyclone", with more than 300mm of rain expected to cause widespread flooding.

Waves crash into a breakwall after Tropical Cyclone Marcia made landfall near Yeppoon.

While south-east Queensland and northern NSW have been hit by big storms in the past - including the "Great Gold Coast Cyclone" of February 1954 - it is likely such events were "hybrids or intense east coast lows" rather than cyclones, he said.

"It's pretty unusual for a category 5 cyclone to strike the coast of Queensland this far south," Associate Professor Walsh said.

Other big storms included a cyclone "very close to category 5" near Mackay in 1918 and Cyclone Dinah, a category 4 storm that stayed mostly offshore, Professor Walsh said.

The Bureau of Meteorology said the near-simultaneous landing of Cyclone Lam on the Northern Territory coast and Cyclone Marcia is the first recorded instance of twin severe cyclone events.
